text:
Sir John Stainton Whitehead GCMG CVO (20 September 1932 – 8 November 2013) is a British diplomat and businessman.
Career.
Whitehead joined the British Foreign Service in 1955.
He was Ambassador from the United Kingdom to Japan (1986 - 1992).
After his retirement from the diplomatic service, he was a senior advisor to Deutsche Bank, Tokyo Electric Power Company (TEPCO) and other international companies.
He became Chairman of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell Trust Bank (Japan).
